title: SUV Crashes Into Massachusetts Apple Store, Killing One; Investigation into crash, which left 16 others injured, is continuing
text:
A dark-colored SUV plowed through the store's plate-glass window and struck multiple people, Mr. Cruz said at a press conference.

Fire and police officers who responded to the scene found injured people both in front of the Apple store and inside, said Hingham Fire Chief Steve Murphy. A few of those inside the shop were pinned against a wall by the SUV.

The injured were being treated at local hospitals and family members were being notified, Mr. Cruz said. Doctors at South Shore Hospital said they received 17 people over 45 minutes. Dr. Christopher Burns, chief of trauma at the hospital, said multiple patients have life-threatening and limb-threatening injuries.

"This morning was an unthinkable morning, and people are trying to get through and process what happened," Mr. Cruz said.

The crash is under investigation. Hingham Police Chief David Jones said details beyond the basics were unavailable, citing the early stages of the investigation.

Write to Talal Ansari at talal.ansari@wsj.com

SUV Crashes Into Massachusetts Apple Store, Killing One
